titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Daniel E. Doody Mount Everest Expedition Papers, 1963
Doody (Daniel E.) Mount Everest Expedition Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by D. Claudia Thompson July 2015

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Daniel E. Doody Mount Everest Expedition papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Diary transcript and photographs of a member of the American Mount Everest Expedition of 1963.

bioghist.head: Biography of Daniel E. Doody
bioghist.p: Daniel E. Doody was the cinematographer on the 1963 American expedition to Mount Everest, which was the first successful American attempt to reach the top. Doody contracted thrombophlebitis and did not reach the summit. In 1965 Doody was killed by a fall on the slopes of Mount Washington in New Hampshire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a typescript of the diary Daniel Doody maintained during the expedition to Mount Everest in 1963. Also included are two photographs of climbing, one photograph of Daniel Doody, one photograph of the American expedition members, and one photograph of Sherpas at the Doody home in Rolling Hills, Connecticut.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Daniel E. Doody at the date of processing. The American Heritage Center holds four other collections related to the American Mount Everest Expedition (1963). These are the John Edgar Breitenbach collection (#2770), the Norman G. Dyhrenfurth collection (#2671), the Luther G. Jerstad collection (#2352), and the Maynard M. Miller collection (#2156).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from Carrie G. Doody and Daniel M. Doody in 1966.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
